content: Bitansky NYUSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationNir Bitansky I'm an associate professor of computer science at NYU Courant and part of the Theory Group and Cryptography Group. I'm broadly interested in the theory of computation and the theory of cryptography in particular.Before joining NYU, I was a faculty member at Tel Aviv University (now on leave). Before  that I was a postdoctoral researcher at MIT CSAIL hosted by Vinod Vaikuntanathan.
